entry.title: Alice Petrossian on Empowering Armenian Women

media:group.media:title: Alice Petrossian on Empowering Armenian Women
media:group.media:description:
Alice Petrossian is an educator, and member of the Board of Directors of the Armenian International Women's Association (AIWA), which is set to host its 9th International Conference in Yerevan this October. Ms. Petrossian speaks to CivilNet about how AIWA has been adapting to the changing needs of women, including what role technology is playing in empowering women globally. She believes in the power of women to collaborate and act united. Ms. Petrossian also speaks about AIWA's efforts, especially amidst the current humanitarian crisis in Artsakh and the political climate, to raise the issue of the humanitarian crisis in Artsakh on its platforms and across its networks.

entry.title: Thomas Graham: The Changing Foundations of the U.S. Russia Policy

media:group.media:title: Thomas Graham: The Changing Foundations of the U.S. Russia Policy
media:group.media:description:
Thomas E. Graham, a distinguished fellow at the Council on Foreign Relations, delivered a lecture entitled โThe Changing Foundations of the United States Russia Policyโ at a symposium on Russia organized by the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey in Tsaghkadzor, Armenia on July 9, 2023.
The lecture was given at an international symposium on Russia organized by the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey in Yerevan and Tsaghkadzor, Armenia on July 2-12, 2023.
Among other positions, Thomas E. Graham served as special assistant to the US president and senior director for Russia on the National Security Council staff from 2004 to 2007, during which he managed a White House-Kremlin strategic dialogue. He was director for Russian affairs on the staff from 2002 to 2004. Graham is a cofounder of the Russian, East European, and Eurasian studies program at Yale University and sits on its faculty steering committee.

entry.title: โItโs not a crisis, itโs a genocide,โ former prosecutor at international court asserts

media:group.media:title: โItโs not a crisis, itโs a genocide,โ former prosecutor at international court asserts
media:group.media:description:
In a breakthrough report on Nagorno-Karabakh (Artsakh), the founding prosecutor of the International Criminal Court Luis Moreno Ocampo classified the situation in the region as Genocide.
โThe blockade of the Lachin Corridor by the Azerbaijani security forces impeding access to any food, medical supplies, and other essentials should be considered a Genocide under Article II, (c) of the Genocide Convention: โDeliberately inflicting on the group conditions of life calculated to bring about its physical destruction.โโ
The Lachin Corridor refers to the only road that connects the region of Nagorno-Karabakh to Armenia and to the rest of the world, which Azerbaijani forces have closed off completely. Under siege, 120,000 Armenians are grappling with severe shortages of food, energy, medicine and other essentials. Deaths and starvation are the new normal in the region.
Calling it genocide by starvation, Ocampo warns that โwithout immediate dramatic change, this group of Armenians will be destroyed in a few weeks.โ
In its assessment, the report refers to Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyevโs deliberate blocking of โthe provision of lifeโs essentials to the Armenians living in Nagorno-Karabakh,โ and his unwillingness to obey orders from the International Court of Justice, โto ensure unimpeded movement of persons, vehicles, and cargo along the Lachin Corridor.
Convoys of aid are awaiting on the Armenian side of the checkpoint, but Baku refuses any aid for the people in Karabakh - a population Baku claims as its own.

ยซิผีธึีฝีกีพีธึ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถยป ีฏีธึีฝีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีซึ ิตึึีกีถีซ ึีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีฟีซ ีฉีฅีฏีถีกีฎีธึ ิดีกีพีซีฉ ิฝีกีชีกีฏีตีกีถีจ, ีธึีจ 2017-ีซึ ีดีกีตึีกึีกีฒีกึีซ ีกีพีกีฃีกีถีธึ ีกีถีคีกีด ีง, ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด ีญีธีฝีธึีด ีง ึีกีฒีกึีกีตีซีถ ีญีถีคีซึีถีฅึีซ ีฌีธึีฎีดีกีถ ีซึ ีบีกีฟีฏีฅึีกึีธึีดีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ:
